description: Tree surgery to all trees as specified in each of the following areas:1.  Pedestrian routes (all areas): Lift to 2.5m and balance crown where required.2.  Vehicle access routes (all areas): Lift to 4.5m and balance crown where required.3.  Lawn areas: Lift to 2.5m and balance crown where required.4.  Animal exhibits (mesh/perimeter): Prune back to clear mesh/perimeter by up to 2.0m, retaining character and habit.5.  Animal exhibits (electrical installations): Prune branches to clear electrical installations.6.  Animal exhibits: Lift to 2.5m and balance crown where required.7.  Squirrel Monkey Exhibit: Prune branches that might facilitate animal escape where required.8.  Meerkat Exhibit: Regular formative pruning of 3 x Tamarix gallica to character and habit within the available space and meet animal welfare requirements.9.  Display Lawn: Prune back from ropes, perches and other installations by up to 1m. Maintain flight paths for display animals through sensitive pruning.10.  Buildings: Prune clear of buildings by up to 2.0m and balance crown where required. 11.  Meshed-over animal exhibits: Carry out formative pruning to retain character and habit within the available space and to meet animal welfare requirements.Tree surgery as specified to all trees of the following species: 12.  Fraxinus excelsior 'Pendula' (all areas): Prune back to previous pruning points.13.  Paulownia tomentosa (all areas): Re-coppice/repollard where required.14.  All species (all areas): Remove basal and trunk epicormic growth to crown break.15.  Quercus spp (all areas): Crown lift to 3 metres above ground level as required to control risk of contact with OPM nests.
